unnormalised: Okay, so exams are looming, right? Specifically, I'm thinking about my cousin Rohan's upcoming NEET exams. He's been buried in books, but also glued to his phone. Turns out, he's using a bunch of exam prep apps. Are these things actually helpful or just another way to procrastinate on Instagram?
normalised: Okay, so exams are looming, right? Specifically, I'm thinking about my cousin Rohan's upcoming N E E T exams. He's been buried in books, but also glued to his phone. Turns out, he's using a bunch of exam prep apps. Are these things actually helpful or just another way to procrastinate on Instagram?

unnormalised: I've seen him use BYJU'S and Vedantu, of course. They're practically ubiquitous. But there are tons of others out there too, like Embibe and Gradeup. Some promise personalised learning, others focus on mock tests, and still others offer video lectures. Rohan says he likes the instant doubt solving features on some â€“ especially when he's stuck on a tough numerical from H.C. Verma.
normalised: I've seen him use B Y J U apostrophe S and Vedantu, of course. They're practically ubiquitous. But there are tons of others out there too, like Embibe and Gradeup. Some promise personalised learning, others focus on mock tests, and still others offer video lectures. Rohan says he likes the instant doubt solving features on some â€“ especially when he's stuck on a tough numerical from H. C. Verma.

unnormalised: My worry is he's spending more time *organizing* his studying on these apps than actually studying. Plus, the constant notifications! 11/11/2023 is a big day for Rohan, but will these apps help him shine? My didi, Priya, thinks they are good because they provide structure. She made him use one for his IIT-JEE prep. He scored well in his 12th boards 78% on 15/08/2020 after attending coaching classes too, so that's reassuring.
normalised: My worry is he's spending more time organizing his studying on these apps than actually studying. Plus, the constant notifications! Eleventh november two thousand and twenty three is a big day for Rohan, but will these apps help him shine? My didi, Priya, thinks they are good because they provide structure. She made him use one for his I I T-J E E prep. He scored well in his twelfth boards seventy eight percent on fifteenth august two thousand and twenty after attending coaching classes too, so that's reassuring.

unnormalised: Anyone else have experience with these? Which ones did you find genuinely helpful for, say, cracking JEE, NEET or even just your college exams in Delhi University? Any tips on using them effectively without getting totally sucked in? I'm thinking of setting timers for him - like study for 45 mins then 15 mins break using the app. Maybe starting 09:00 hrs every day. Let's discuss! Share your thoughts and recommendations!

I'm thinking of setting timers for him - like study for forty five minutes then fifteen minutes break using the app. Maybe starting nine hundred hours every day. Let's discuss!
